segment.source: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)
segment.target: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)

segment.source: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)
segment.target: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)

segment.source: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)
segment.target: DISM Reference (Deployment Image Servicing and Management)

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) is a command-line tool that is used to service Windows® images offline before deployment.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) is a command-line tool that is used to service Windows® images offline before deployment.

segment.source: You can use it to install, uninstall, configure, and update Windows features, packages, drivers, and international settings.
segment.target: You can use it to install, uninstall, configure, and update Windows features, packages, drivers, and international settings.

segment.source: Subsets of the DISM servicing commands are also available for servicing a running operating system.
segment.target: Subsets of the DISM servicing commands are also available for servicing a running operating system.

segment.source: For more information, see What is DISM?.
segment.target: For more information, see What is DISM?.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options

segment.source: Lists the command-line options for managing and servicing a Windows image with the Dism.exe tool.
segment.target: Lists the command-line options for managing and servicing a Windows image with the Dism.exe tool.

segment.source: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files
segment.target: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files

segment.source: Describes how to create a configuration list to exclude files and folders from an image capture or compression.
segment.target: Describes how to create a configuration list to exclude files and folders from an image capture or compression.

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices

segment.source: Describes some best practices related to servicing a Windows image.
segment.target: Describes some best practices related to servicing a Windows image.

segment.source: We recommend that you implement these practices wherever possible.
segment.target: We recommend that you implement these practices wherever possible.

segment.source: Service a Windows PE Image with DISM
segment.target: Service a Windows PE Image with DISM

segment.source: Describes information specific to using DISM to configure a Windows PE image.
segment.target: Describes information specific to using DISM to configure a Windows PE image.

segment.source: DISM Supported Platforms
segment.target: DISM Supported Platforms

segment.source: Describes the different operating systems and architectures supported by DISM.
segment.target: Describes the different operating systems and architectures supported by DISM.

segment.source: Configure a Windows Repair Source
segment.target: Configure a Windows Repair Source

segment.source: Describes how to configure and maintain a Windows image repair source to use within your network.
segment.target: Describes how to configure and maintain a Windows image repair source to use within your network.

segment.source: The repair source can be used to restore Windows features or to repair a corrupted Windows image.
segment.target: The repair source can be used to restore Windows features or to repair a corrupted Windows image.
